author: SetTrend
body:
PowerShell 7.2.4 and VS Code both display notifications, advertising PowerShell Core 7.2.5. But there's no 7.2.5 listed in Microsoft Docs nor here in the Releases table.

**Is this a phishing scam situation?** What is the truth about version 7.2.5?

comments.author: tmccraw
comments.body: master/tools/metadata.json also hasn't been updated with StableReleaseTag v.7.2.5, so tools like master/tools/install-powershell.ps1 aren't aware of it.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
7.2.5 was released 2 days ago: https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.2.5
GitHub
Release v7.2.5 Release of PowerShell · PowerShell/PowerShell
7.2.5 - 2022-06-21 Engine Updates and Fixes Fix native library loading for osx-arm64 (#17495) (Thanks @awakecoding!) Tests Make Assembly Load Native test work on a FX Dependent Linux Install (#1...

title: I'm receiving notifications about version 7.2.5 – but there's no 7.2.5 released
